p: The chemical formula of remdesivir, with a molecular mass of 602.6, is C 27H 35N 6O 8P. Remdesivir can be effectively metabolised to active nucleoside triphosphate in several human cell lines [15]. An in vitro study has demonstrated that nucleoside triphosphate works as an incorporation competitor with adenosine triphosphate, confuses viral RdRp, acts as a delayed RNA chain terminator against Ebola virus [15, 16], evades proofreading by viral exoribonuclease, and causes a decrease in viral RNA production [17]. Recently, the antiviral activity of remdesivir was demonstrated at the stage after virus entry into Vero E6 cells, supporting its antiviral mechanism as a nucleotide analogue [18].
